title: Which university is best for law in England? - Quora

response.answer_text: The usual suspects ! Oxford and Cambridge. Most lawyers in the City of London working as commercial /corporate lawyers are Oxbridge graduates. If you can't get into either of those two universities next in line in the pecking order are: University College London, Kings College London, & The London School of Economics. Then Durham, University of Bristol, University of Nottingham, & University of Manchester. I personally know someone who got a job as a corporate lawyer in a major City of London law firm, with a 1st Class Hons in Law from University of Liverpool. But that was in 1993.
Cambridge and Oxford are the best of course Next in line is LSE, UCL, Durham,Leeds,York, Warwick etc I would search the complete university guide if you want extended information
